description:
Service here is very nice. The staff is friendly and has good recommendations. The flavor choice is very unique and exquisitely tasty. 
I am so glad we came here for a nice treat after dinner. My favorite flavors: whiskey praline and dulce de leche... to die for!

Both times I went, no line and great prices.
author: Camille C.

description:
Lush is always my go to for gelato in this neighborhood! Their ice cream flavors change regularly and there is always something new to try on every time I come back. 

Pro: Their place is very bright and clean with neat decorations! There are two small tables where you could take a quick shot with your ice creams! Not a spacious place to hang out with friends, but you are welcome to sit at the outside bench as well. 

Con: From my experience, their staff is always hiding in the kitchen after taking your order.  It is not as helpful when I have questions or need immediate help
author: Shuyi L.

description:
The pictures off these stacks of ice cream scoops drew me in and the unique list of flavors sealed the deal. I love the flavors, inspired by locally sourced ingredients and unique with a nod to nostalgia. They had flavors such as: dulce de leche, fromage and cookie dough, ricotta and lemon, Vietnamese cinnamon.

I got a small which comes with up to two flavors. I got the dulce de leche and malted milk with salted chocolate chips. It was $4.25 for two scoops. Very fair pricing in SF. The guy was also very patient and generous with samples.

I was just a little disappointed with the texture of the gelato. The dulce de leche was fine, but the malted milk had some chunks of ice. Maybe it was just a bad batch, but I just wanted a little more creaminess and smoothness.
author: Kim W.

description:
Some great flavors on Polk street . Small venue like most Gelato spots. Walked up to the counter and looked at about the 6-10 flavors and the two below "spoke to me". 

I went with :
Dulce De Leche- Carmelized milk- "better than salted caramel"
Tres Leches & Alfajores Pieces - 

Both were very good and I thought they complimented each other very well kinda like my wife and I (I kid I kid). 

I like that this place (and others on the list below) had unique flavors since that's what makes me go out of my way for places. 

So many darn good sweets places in this city. I have my rankings below.

So many good ice cream/gelato/chocolate spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 

I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Polly Ann Ice Cream
5 Salt and straw
6 Chocolate Covered
7 Loving Cup
8 Smitten Ice Cream
9 Teuscher Chocolate 
10 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
11 Over the Moon
12 Lush Gelato
13 The Ice Cream Bar
14 Coletta Gelato
15 Cako Creamery
16 Bi-Rite Creamery
17 San Francisco's Hometown Creamery 
18 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
19 Mitchells Ice cream
20 St. Francis Fountain
21 Z Cioccolato
22 Joe's Ice Cream
23 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
24 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
25 Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop
26 Recchiuti Confections 
27 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description:
Fresh batch gelato with unique flavors! I had the fall specials but they're always coming out with new flavors. 
Cognac & peach pie swirl - can't go wrong with this combination 
Creme fraiche & apple crisp - super creamy
Pumpkin spice chocolate chunks tasted just like pumpkin pie
Spiked eggnog & chocolate waffle chunks - usually not a fan of eggnog but this was really good
author: Vicky R.

description:
Amazing! Orange + peach + praline is majestic! Probably one of the most unique and distinct gelato flavors I've ever had. The praline was perfect and the fruit flavor was a great complement. You can tell the gelato is artisanally crafted...

I will definitely be coming back for more gelato.
author: Hanna S.

description: Got a small cup of Dulce de Leche flavored ice cream while waiting for an appointment nearby. AND IT'S SO GOOD! It is very rich, creamy, and flavorful. It's like eating straight from the Dulce de Leche spread jar (that's how flavorful it is). Definitely coming back to try out their other flavors
author: Isabela N.

description: I love this gelato place so much! The flavor options are plentiful and you're bound to find something you like. Also, the person running the front counter is very sweet and so ready to let you try sample after sample. The store itself is cute and has seating if it's not too busy!
author: Kalani R.

description: Vietnamese cinnamon? Whiskey praline? Espresso chocolate chunk...? Yaaaaas pleeeeeeeasse! Tried as many flavors as we could without being obnoxious. It's worth it to ask for tastes; no matter what you think the gelato will taste like, your taste buds will be surprised. The small cup only holds one small scoop, so definitely go with a medium. You can try two flavors next to each other. Even better to go to Lush with a group so that you can get different flavors and share! You really cannot go wrong no matter what you order. A medium cup of gelato will run you about $5. There's another location on Piedmont Avenue in Oakland if you find yourself on the other side of the bay.
author: Ray J.

description:
Smoothest, creamiest, most amazing gelato I've ever had! Lush Gelato is a little shop packing a big flavor punch. 

The small size cup nets you up to 2 flavors, and I picked the chocolate and peanut butter and the mint chocolate. Both were incredible, but the mint chocolate was a particular high-five. The amount of mint was a perfect balance with the amount of chocolate.

The bill was also nice. I've had pricier gelato that wasn't half as good.
author: Shane K.

description: Came here after dinner with two other friends - two people in front of us but it went by fast. One lady working the entire shop and she was unfriendly. No smiles, no greetings as if she hated being there. We tried two before finalizing on our items which was a single scoop that came with 1-2 flavors and the homemade waffle cone is $0.75 (and no other cones). I went with the malted milk with salted chocolate chunks - not bad but nothing special compared to all the other ice cream options in San Francisco. $4.25 for single scoops so my total was a little less than $14. For the experience and quality, I am not wowed.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Wow Wow Wow!!! I thought I had just about conquered all the best ice cream spots in SF, but I was wrong.  I know its Portland-based, but Salt & Straw has been my ultimate for SF until now. Stumbled upon Lush and its life-changing.  I had a Mascarpone-based flavor as well as a Mint-based one that lit up my night.  Can't wait to go back and hit all the other flavors.  
Also, no line and cozy little corner nooks by the window to sit at.  Love this little place.
author: John H.

description: We came here at around 8pm and received very good service. We were recommended a couple of flavours of which were excellent. I had the Salted almond toffee and the Dulce de leche. As expected from gelato - it was soft, creamy and easy to eat. Both flavours were rich and deep in their respective tastes.
author: Jack D.

description: Looks like the kind of place I'd bring a first date to after getting dinner or something. There are two sofas on opposite ends of the restaurant and soft lighting. A medium selection of options plus one non dairy pick. Their flavors rotate but they always have the basics
author: Gina B.

description:
Inventive flavor combinations are created in this tiny shop. The gelato making magic can be viewed through the window behind the cashier. One can sample all the delicious flavors, and then sit at one of two tables and watch the passersby of Polk Street.

Lush supplies several local restaurants, and its gelato has excellent quality. All that I've tried are good, but I usually opt for the sorbet which allows the fruit to shine. They often create new flavors, so stop by weekly or daily!
author: Carol W.

description:
Here's another review for a very current (today) fatty moment or eh semi-hungover from 2 drinks last night? Whatever it may be, I decided I needed some ice cream stat and not from Walgreens (yuck generic mint chip worst ever!)

This place is literally a block away, so being lazy I decided to stop by...plus their Instagram page is lit with great pics and yummy flavors, seemingly a popular spot amongst ice cream lovers. The place itself is very small, literally like a mini ice cream shop. The guy was friendly and let me try a couple flavors, which are interesting combos like caramel apple and mint chip pecan, not typical ice cream flavors (well this is gelato I guess). I got a couple flavors in a pint, the mint chip and caramel pecan swirl, along with an Argentinean chocolate (Alfajaro) that my BF used to make me eat, lol. Together was $11 which was very fair, as I got a two person serving, haha. 

Overall was good but nothing extraordinary, maybe I'm just not a fan of these interesting flavors...the gelato wasn't as ice cream-y as I liked as well, a little soft. I think I'll stick to Swensen's or something else...let's be real, it will probably be a Ben N Jerrys.
author: Mahsa T.

description: I love Lush gelato. I love their posts on Instagram where they discuss the new flavors they are developing. I stop by quite often sometimes to pick up a scoop or a pint. I've tried so many flavors and have never been unhappy. I recently had the burrata Meyer lemon gelato which is delicious. I've had the strawberry, pluot, yellow nectarine, and many others including a Nutella flavor and chocolate flavor. Everything is good. I would say you just can't go wrong here.
author: Danielle S.

description: Delicious gelato that is always so creamy when it's fresh! Really love all the unique flavors, especially the citrus cardamon.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco for the first time and ended up at Lush Gelato by chance; I was having a pregnancy emergency at 9:30pm and demanded my husband call an uber and get me to Swensen's Ice Cream immediately. Well, they were closed for New Years Day and I almost died of disappointment but then, like magic, my amazing uber driver knew how dire of a situation this was and just drove me straight to Lush (even though next to try on my list was Salt+Straw).
I'll admit I was disappointed when he dropped me off at a gelato place - I knew I wanted straight up old school ice cream, but, being pregnant and now stuck on Polk Street after getting out of the uber I had no choice but to walk in and give them a try. 

First impressions:
This shop is tiny and adorable - I can see myself sitting in this little table by the window where the lights are strung so magically. 
Small selection - hmmm, not much to choose from but wait, these flavors look incredible. 
WOAH, NELLY - who crapped in this lady's ice cream? The woman at the counter would not crack one smile or even return my greeting - and looked like she wanted to put my head in a guillotine for asking for a sample.
HOLY GOD THIS IS GOOD - the best gelato I have ever had? Definitely. I don't even care about the scary gelato lady anymore. Mascarpone Chocolate Chip? I will give you my first born, in utero, for the entire tub of this. SO creamy and delectable. 

This gelato was so good that I hailed another uber the next evening for a 2nd helping, despite the possible encounter of the scary gelato lady. Thankfully when I arrived for Round 2 there was a gentleman working and he was much more pleasant (as I have read) and even let me get half and half in a small cup! I indulged in the Mascarpone Chocolate Chip again but this time let it dance next to the Creme Fraiche Apple Pie. 

Perfection.
author: Nichole R.

description:
I went here with my mother and we were absolutely fascinated with the truly craftily delicious flavors! The delectable taste and rich, luxuriously creamy texture was beyond the beyonds! I enjoyed the caramel port fig and strawberry basalmic experience; both incredibly delicious to the tenth power!  Mother had Mexican chocolate and peanut butter; she was flipping! I wish we had a location in San Diego so I could taste all the flavorery in good time. Alas some day I'll return. 

~ Raynebow Ocean
www.VerryMerryUnBirthday.com
author: Rainbow O.

description:
DULCE DE LECHE!!!

Get  a pint folks, do not skimp. You will thank me later.

I adore this little ice cream shop on Polk! It's an ice cream shop that CARES. And they let you sample to your heart's delight. 

It's apparently owned by an Argentinian person which is fantastic because Argentinian people are spicy and are spicing up the ice cream industry with this little gem packed with sometimes obscure but also traditional flavors. I will be back to order a pint of every flavor possible. Also dont forget to order the chocolate covered Argentinian cookies in the cookie jar! Sugar overkill? Blasphemy... no such thing!
author: Connie M.

description: I love a good gelato! I am technically on a diet, but when I saw the odd but creative flavors I couldn't help myself! I ended up getting a scoop of horchata and it was delicious. Tasted exactly like the real thing! I would love to come back and try some of the other flavors. Small shop, small selection of flavors but it's seems as if they switch them up often. That could be a good or bad thing! Will definitely be returning.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
The flavors were okay that day, well at least to me. Nothing special. The gelato was indeed very smooth. My favorite was their whiskey pecan and would get it again if I do come back. 

I'm being nice with the 3 star but it was service without a smile. I was reading some of the reviews and said services was good? Well not for me. I greet them with a smile but not expression back. Took them a few minutes before they came outside to service me as well. Maybe it was just the staff that day but not good at all. I live half a mile away and not sure if I want to come back. And they were out of cones, its not like they were busy and I was the only person there.
author: Sandy B.

description: Had brunch down the street and happened to score a spot right in front of Lush Gelato. Promised my 10 year old that I would get her a scoop on our way back to the car. he was disappointed that the mango was out so she opted for the creme fraiche with apple crisp. I got a small taste and the creme fraiche really stood out. The lady working behind the counter wasn't the friendliest person, she didn't greet us, nor did she thank us... she may have grunted at us. There was no one waiting and no line... so not sure what rubbed her the wrong way. Customer service is key, I guess she didn't get that memo.
author: Dina V.

description:
I am picky when it comes to ice cream and gelato, but this place is truly fantastic. 
Reasons I keep coming back:
1. Local, organic ingredients make the gelato fresh and you know they care when they are making it instead of using artificial flavors
2. Changing flavors that balance unique yet comforting 

However, it is really small inside so definitely don't plan to come hang out. Instead go to the cute vintage shop next door with your gelato.
author: Anna S.

description:
Love love and the owner is generous and nice! All the flavors are unique and switched up often. It's a little place in SF, but it's def a great place! 
I got: 
-Chocolate 
-Dulce de leche 
-Whisky Walnut
-Earl Grey
All stacked nicely for the photo and all with amazing taste! I can't choose a favorite.
author: Sun L.

description:
What to do after a large Blue Smoke sandwich at Crave? Take a long walk and grab a Lush Gelato along the way.  I picked a very yummy dark chocolate, and wished I could have had a taste of a few other flavors. What a great dessert!

p.s. - As much as I love gourmet gelato and ice cream, put me back in the Midwest with a DQ soft serve, and I'm just as happy. :)
author: Eric B.

description: Love this place ! Super cute inside. Had a few tables to sit inside. I tried the Ricotta and lemon zeta gelato. TO DIE FOR. They had various other flavors and they let you sample them beforehand ! A small cup was $4.50.
author: Uyen N.

description:
*** In Short ***

Your usual (fancy) run-of-the-mill Bay Area gelato.

*** In Depth ***

To be fair, the average gelato spot in the Bay is actually pretty decent, but because there are so many in the area, one should consider how to best spend their money (and calories!). While the sign outside touts interesting and unique flavors, the night we went, the only thing that I hadn't seen at the majority of other gelato shops was a peach habanero: otherwise, you had your usual suspects of coffee, chocolate, mint, etc.

Nothing particularly worth noting, but expect the usual rich creaminess you'd find at most gelato shops (but not nearly as creamy as Coletta), albeit with what I can only describe as more muted and less "real"-tasting flavors.

Not necessarily bad if you're in the area and looking for dessert, but given the other top notch choices in the city, I don't see myself ever coming back.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - The area around Lush can be rather hilly, while the shop itself is on the smaller side, with two tables for seating on either side. The display counters are your usual high top displays, so you may find yourself reaching for flavor samples if the person serving you doesn't reach around.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description: Dulce De Leche and the Ricotta Lemon Zest are very delicious and outstanding flavors.
author: Simona A.

description:
Decent gelato in SF but nothing extraordinary. Some interesting flavors like ricotta lemon. The owner is really nice and friendly and he's passionate about gelato. But lady working there seemed indifferent.

Argentine gelato is not very different from Italian gelato - but it's a bit too creamy for me. Texture is interesting but the gelatos are generally not citrusty enough for me to enjoy.

Hard to differentiate a business in crowded SF, and this one does an okay job.
author: Sang P.

description: Ok gelato with poor service. With the number of ice cream places around San Francisco, I found this one leaving me wishing that I had gone to a different one. The pricing and selection are pretty much par for the course and the quality is average. I take off for the poor service--the woman working there (the owner?) may not have said even one word to me and I was the only person there at the time.
author: Mike K.

description:
Very impressed with the quality of gelato here. Ordered the espresso chocolate chunk and it was a great decision. The gelato was creamy and thick, though I wished it had more of a coffee flavor. 

The lady who helped us was very sweet. She was patient enough to let me try half the flavors on display. As an indecisive person, picking out an ice cream flavor is a very difficult task especially when it comes to flavors I've never tried. I like the fact that there intriguing flavors for the risk takers and original flavors for everyone else.
author: Nancy C.

description: Lush is amazing. The owner is super nice and friendly, and as you come in, usually you'll smell the fresh made waffle cones. Yes, they make their own waffle cones! They also create new flavors here and there. The variety is creative. The spot is strategically in Polk, so you'll be able to shop and walk around the area with this gelato. Reasonably priced, you won't regret it.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I never spent much time in the Polk / Nob Hill area, but now because of this gem of a gelateria I will keep finding reasons to come back.


---- GELATO FLAVOURS ----

Bellwether Farms Ricotta Lemon: 5 stars
This might be my favorite gelato flavour ever. Definitely top 3.  The texture is flawless and the creamy yet refreshing citrus body makes this gelato dangerously addictive.

Cowgirl Creamery Fromage Blanc: 4 stars
Similar to a cheesecake flavour but lighter than you might expect.  Good but overshadowed by the Ricotta Lemon to me.

Tres Leches and Alfajores Pieces: 5 stars

Mascarpone Balsamic w Chocolate Chunks: 4.5 stars
author: Letitia L.

description:
Obsessed with Lush! 

It's owned by a lovely Argentinian man, and you can tell his gelato is from the heart. If you've never had argentine gelato, it's a treat -- as light and fluffy as Italian gelato but with much more interesting flavors.

My all time favorite is the olive oil -- incredibly creamy and unusual. I'm also a huge fan of the lemons zest ricotta (tangy, subtlety sweet) and Mexican chocolate (spicy, like a chocolate chai latte).

The prices are more than reasonable compared to other ice cream options in the city, and unlike birite, there's always a place to sit! 

Would definitely head to nob hill for a visit to lush.
author: Lee C.

description: Awesome local ice cream joint. They have creative flavors that sound interesting but nearly always taste delicious. The flavors change constantly so you get a good variety every time you go, and they're open late. Buy a pint or two and bring it to your next party - our guests absolutely loved it.
author: Denise H.

description:
Yes, I am a fan of this little cute gelato shop at Polk Street. Actually, I've always wanted to check this place out but keep forgetting. Finally, last Sunday, I was able to check this place out. I didn't do any research and came in and asked the guy what he recommends and he recommended two flavors one I dont remember but the other one was with whiskey ice cream with nuts. OH MY GAWD! It was delicious. Like I so regret ordering a small size. I wished I ordered the largest size but you know I'm trying to lose some pounds but urgghhh 

Anyways, they have plenty of gelato flavors to choose from and I'll definitely come back at Lush Gelato. This is definitely a hidden gem in San Francisco. 

I. AM. A . FAN.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I walk by this place all the time when I'm out for lunch. Even the sweet and warm smell outside of the store is inviting. One day I saw that they had a watermelon mixed with another fruit (I forgot what it was) flavor. I'm a sucker for watermelon flavored anything. I really wanted to try it but I didn't because it would've spoiled my appetite for lunch. 

This time, I decided to finally try it out, considering what a lovely warm day it was. Unfortunately, they didn't have the watermelon flavor at the time. I ended up going with the green tea gelato and it did not disappoint. The flavor was wonderful and creamy. Even when the gelato was melting, it turned very thick and creamy as opposed to liquidy.
author: Annie H.

description:
Hmmm delicious gelato with a variety of interesting flavours. I've always liked their gelati, whenever I see them in restaurants. They do a really good Mexican chocolate, as well as caramel. 

This time, in store, I got to see more seasonal flavours, like balsamic vinegar and cream, which worked wonderfully well. 

San Francisco is always a bit too chilly for me to indulge in frozen desserts, but it's worth it when it's both delicious and interesting.
author: Alice C.

description:
Never in my life have I've been so thankful for meeting Fede and eating his creations. He even was kind enough to make a flavour I wanted to have for my birthday (and yes, I totally recommend getting a gallon of gelato for your birthday). Great quality, great service, supreme ingredients. I've tried over 20 different ones (at least) and I'm always impressed about how some combinations work out (like balsamic vinegar, blue cheese, stout, and some other things most people wouldn't think of when they think about gelato)
The world needs more places like this!!
author: Angélica Z.

description:
This is the best ice cream shop in town, hands down! 

The ice cream is made in the back of the shop, you can actually see it from the front desk. Also, they keep updating their selection of flavors, but dulce de leche is their trademark. 

Don't miss this place!
author: Juan S.

description: After walking up and down the beautifully steep hills of SF, Lush Gelato was the light at the end of the tunnel for Jordan and I. I got a small cup with scoops of the sweet cream and the crème brulee and ERMAGODDDD so good! Jordan got the Asian Pear and was so taken by its great flavor, he's been looking for it back home in Houston. Small quaint little restaurant with two tables to sit as people walk by.
author: Chace W.

description:
It's been a while since I've had some good gelato.  So on one cold and rainy afternoon (I know, perfect weather for gelato, right?), I visited Lush Gelato with a friend. 

They had a very interesting assortment of flavors (http://bit.ly/1RXL0Nw).  All of them sounded good, but the ones that got my attention were Cardamom Orange, Whiskey Almond Crunch, Banana Salted Caramel, and Orange Zest Chocolate.  Luckily with the weather being cold and rainy, they weren't busy at all and we instantly got to try all the flavors before selecting what to get.

Ultimately we split a two scoop order with Banana Salted Caramel & Orange Zest Chocolate (http://bit.ly/1YMN4dW).  The combination of these two flavors made it almost like having a banana split but not so heavy.  The banana flavor was really prominent and the orange chocolate reminded me of those Orange Chocolate squares that you get from See's Candies.  Very tart and tangy and I enjoyed every bit of it.

Overall, it was a very good experience at Lush Gelato.  The flavors do rotate and are seasonal so they will almost always be different every day.  I do hope they keep around the flavors I tried that day when I go back, but it they don't I'm pretty sure they'll have some other flavors that I'll probably enjoy just as much.
author: Rodney H.

description: LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT! Did dulce de leche as the guy out there recommended, and will definitely be back!
author: Zeynep D.

description: What a great gelato place! Firstly, it's two different flavors in one scoop, which is always a plus in my book. Second, they have rotating flavors that are so unique that who'd a thunk they'd taste so good? For example, I had Asian pear sorbet with a salted (or maybe it was toasted?) almond gelato, which was a delicious combo. The Asian pear one was especially great. My friend had a ricotta one that was super cheesy, but an interesting combo all the same! One word to note, if you're looking for a regular flavor like vanilla, chocolate, or strawberry, and don't get me wrong, I love those basic flavors, you might not find that here. However, my advice to you is to be adventurous!
author: Sruthi S.

description:
Remember when ice cream parlors were bastions of cheeriness no matter how forced it was with acne-laden teens in barbershop-quartet outfits scooping cones like nobody's business? I don't know when a general sense of ennui took over the higher-end ice cream shops, but that's what greeted us here. This is the third of the Lush Gelato shops to open and the first in San Francisco. East Bay friends had been raving about the one on Piedmont Avenue in Oakland for years, but I could never find an opportunity to try it out. I was thrilled to see this shop as Jamie W. and I were strolling along Polk on the way to Aquatic Park.

A scoop costs $3.50 and you add a dollar for each additional scoop. Jamie was good and just had a scoop of the Raspberry Sorbetto which was pretty refreshing (photo:  http://bit.ly/1OYsuGC). I went for full-on decadent and went with a double scoop of Mexican Chocolate and Banana Salted Caramel (photo: http://bit.ly/1SfkXUf). It was definitely creamy but not quite the flavor explosion I was hoping for. We returned a couple of months later, and I tried the Vietnamese Cinnamon to go with the Mexican Chocolate this time (photo: http://bit.ly/1neGAra). I'm still not quite a fan as I think the indifference was leaving more of an impression than the gelato.

GELATO - 3.5 stars...certainly creamy enough though not really that memorable
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...small space with a couple of tables if youc are to stick around
SERVICE - 2 stars...a little more genuine interest in the customer would have been nice
TOTAL - 3 stars...a straw hat and a rainbow-stripe vest might help
author: Ed U.

description:
So surprise I can still stuff my face after House of Prime Rib dinner!

Got a small cup of toffee almond chocolate on vanilla gelato. Nice and fresh. Small scoop for $3.50 (medium for $4.50, large for $5.50; if you want a cone, it's .75 cents).

They are open late, and just 1 person working. Please be patient and understanding!
author: Mary H.

description: Cute and small store. Came here after the sf Zoo for a treat and it was good. Only a few flavors to choose from and not many places to sit really. Wish there could have been a friendlier person to help us cause the lady seemed like she was so done with customers hahahaha
author: Katherine D.

description: Good quality tasty ice cream.  Generally weird at night, and Lush gets a bad review for last night's experience.  The lady making ice cream in the back is a bit of a brute, and does not seem interested in scooping ice cream.  In her defense, she has to walk all the way to the back of the production area to the room's only door to come up the hallway to the front to serve customers as they trickle in.  It's a bad design and a long walk.  But it would be a good idea for Lush to have someone scooping ice cream that was at least a little friendly.  Incidentally, my wife's ice cream had a piece of plastic in it.  We would have said something, but the     lady was already in the back again and didn't come out for the rest of the time we were there.  We could see her staring through the glass window that separates the production room from the cafe but couldn't talk to her, making it all a little weirder than necessary.
author: peter d.

description: Forgot what flavor I got, but it was okay. I sampled a few other flavors and they were meh. The lady working there didn't greet us or seem hospitable. Inside is small, and the table we sat at was dirty and sticky. Not sure why the staff does not clean up the place, especially when there isn't much foot traffic. Def don't recommend.
author: Michael B.

description: Lush gelato is a gem on Polk! Boutique flavors that keep changing as their kitchen churns out new seasonal flavors. Perfect place for dessert after a meal at any one of the many restaurants nearby. I usually get the cups but their waffle cones are quite delectable. The gelato here is a wonderful creamy consistency rich in flavor and texture. Most recently: creme brûlée (sweet subtle flavor with nice touch of brown sugar crystals throughout) and almond salted toffee (nutty flavor well balanced with toffee and a hint of salt). They also sell pints, perfect for picnics or parties. Seating is sparse but they have some comfortable cushion seats inside and a couple of small benches out front. Overall, a nice spot to drop in for some quality flavors!
author: David L.

description: This was some of the tastiest gelato I've ever had. All the flavors are amazing so it's hard to pick which one to go with!! I definitely recommend this place for any gelato craving. My husband and I are from out of town and love gelato. Happy we found this cute little spot!
author: Kayla C.

description: Surprise spot! Randomly came across on a Sunday afternoon and was surprised at how delicious the gelato was! We got the mint, tres leches & apple creme fraiche. Creamy, rich, velvety flavor / texture! Delicious!
author: Nina T.

description: Waffle cones are amazing, as is the gelato. Went two days in a row because hubby missed out on day one and the kids talked it up so much and the flavors changed - what a treat!! Super smooth, friendly staff, worth the visit!
author: laurie s.

description:
Came here because my girlfriend found them on Instagram, and they had a donut ice cream sandwich that looked great. To our surprise, they don't regularly serve them, and they did it in the Summer time only.

The person who helped us seemed like he may have been the owner, and was very helpful and let us sample all of the flavors. Then he gave us a chocolate covered cookie with caramel on the inside to make up for not having the donuts. It was actually really good! It was very close to a Tim Tam. 

We pulled the trigger on green tea and dulce de leche. Great gelato for sure. SF has some amazing ice cream places, that may be better have more variety, but I suggest you add this place on your list to stop by. 5 star experience for sure, check them out!
author: Brandon F.

description: So glad i found this gelato place. They offer very unique flavors and let me tell you each one of them that i have tried have been amazing. I want to go back and try more flavors for sure. Customer service was the person in the front who helped us was extremely nice and helpful. Thank you lush gelato!
author: Jessi L.

description:
Delicious, delicious, delicious! I honestly can't think of a better gelato place that I've been to. From the creativity of the flavors to the satisfaction of having the most perfect dessert, everything about Lush is wonderful.

I absolutely love unique and out-of-the-box ice cream/gelato/froyo flavors, and Lush surprised me with how many unconventional flavors that they serve. In fact the large majority of all their flavors are unique and non-traditional. And, the best part is that the names are accurately descriptive of what flavors you're going to experience in your mouth. 

I went with a friend (and fellow Yelper) who was nonstop raving about Lush ever since he tried it for the first time. We went on a Tuesday evening, and the place had the cutest ambiance, with small tables for sitting and chatting and lights hung up along the walls and windows. I wound up trying a lot of different flavors because I was so blown away from the uniqueness of the flavors.

Wound up choosing the Creme Fraiche & Strawberry Gelato, and I absolutely loved it. It was such a high-quality step up from your typical strawberry gelato, since the gelato itself had more of a Creme Fraiche flavor while the strawberry flavor was added with fresh strawberries in the mix! So fresh, and so delicious.

My friend, a regular now, got the Dulce de Leche and Cowgirl Creamery flavors. Lucky for me, he's a sharer, so I was able to try his flavors, and got to experience the wonderfulness of them both. The Dulce de Leche is just bursting with creamy, caramel flavor in a satisfying yet not overwhelming manner. The Cowgirl Creamery is one that he's gotten multiple times, and I can't blame him. It has a great creaminess from the fromage blanc and chunkiness from the cookie dough that makes for a perfect combination of textures and flavors.

Price is absolutely reasonable for the portion sizes and the freshness of the gelato. You can even walk to the back of the store and see employees making gelato during the day. 

If you have a sweet tooth (like I do) and want to go for some incredible frozen desserts, choose Lush. No questions asked.
author: Sheila D.

description: I went to their new location. Fantastic gelato! Some of the best I've had outside of Italy. Creative flavors! I ordered a medium and chose 4 different flavors. The cowgirl was delicious, the cardamom orange zest had so much depth of flavor, the malted vanilla and salted chocolate was also delicious. The only one I though was just ok was the espresso chip. The service was great. Definitely a solid gelato stop in San Fran.
author: Josh H.

description: This place was fantastic. The flavors are really strong (in a good way). I'd suggest getting the honey lavender and creme fraiche strawberry balsamic (I think that's what it's called). Either way, I'm sure all the flavors are great and the server was really friendly. You should definitely try it out if you want to feed your sweet tooth.
author: Charles T.

description:
Awesome for the recent heat wave we've had! We shared a medium with 3 flavors: the banana, mint, and cowgirl creamery cookie dough after trying almost all of their flavors (all the ones we tried were great). Thanks for being patient with us :)

Creamiest cookie dough ice cream, almost too thick to eat alone! Banana was delightful, perfect blend of creamy and fruity. Mint was great too! 

We will be back!
author: Mingmei N.

description:
This is some smooth, smooth gelato, son.

I got a cone of Vietnamese cinnamon and it was outta sight.

What more is to be said of gelato?  It is delicious.  Enjoy some.
author: Ben B.

description: I went there last night with my husband. They let us sample as many flavors as we wanted. I got the cookies and cream & peanut butter chip. Both flavors were very good. My husband got a whiskey and vanilla flavored gelato. He enjoyed it as well. I thought it kind of tasted more like ice cream than gelato, but I liked it .
author: Shontel O.

description: Really? 4.5 stars for all locations of Lush Gelato? I eat a lot of ice cream and gelato and this one was nothing special. The store didn't feel welcoming. When we entered, it was empty and no one was even in the front of the shop. When the lady came out, I almost felt like I was bothering her by asking her to scoop some for me. The window-front seating area was not comfortable. The whole experience felt cold and sterile, not happy and warm. The gelato itself did not leave a strong impression on me.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Super cold ice cream. That's how M would describe their gelato lol. The consistency is not quite right but it's still delicious. 

I wanted dessert after dinner at HoPR and this was super close. Outside the store, I sampled the creme fraiche with strawberry balsamic and it tasted like cheesecake! I was in the mood for something less fruity, though.

After sampling, I got the banana with caramel and the vanilla with salted chocolate. M got the mint chip and the dark chocolate but he didn't get to taste them since he was in the car. He thought the mint was too minty. 

We both agreed that we would prefer the flavors to be side by side instead of on top of each other since every other gelato place presents it that way you can switch between flavors.

I would probably come back since it's cheaper to get a small cup here with two Flavors instead of paying almost double at HoPR for one scoop of boring ice cream flavors.
author: Lena H.

description:
Good ones!! Love them, super tasty.
My kids really enjoy this place, prices are ok also for S Francisco.
Yummyyyyy
author: Patricia B.

description: This is a San Francisco gem. Their flavors are constantly changing which gives me an excuse to keep coming to see what's new. Chef Federico's gelatos are unique and delish. I sampled the Fromage Cookie Dough and the Fresh Mint Chip (it's like garden mint), but I ended up going for the Mascarpone Balsamic and Dark Chocolate. Lush gelato has become my favorite spot for ice cream in the Bay Area. Great texture and very authentic flavors. Highly recommended!
author: Matilda B.

description: Best gelato in the city!!! I discovered this spot through a friend of mine that brought me for some sweet treats. Most of the times, you can see them making the gelato on the spot. They make the whole process from scratch (I believe they're the only ones in San Francisco doing the whole thing in house). Very creative flavors. On my last visit I sampled the Cowgirl Creamery Fromage Blanc Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough and the Fresh Mint Chip (it's like garden mint), but I ended up going for the Mascarpone Balsamic and Dark Chocolate. If you want to enjoy the finest gelato ever then you need to give this place a try; you'll realize how amazing gelato can be when you buy it at the top shop in San Francisco.
author: Serge B.

description:
Happy I passed this place! It's really cute and has some seating inside. You can try different flavors here like earl grey and green tea.

I got a scoop of the lemon ricotta gelato ($3.50). It was creamy and had a really unique flavor. Definitely a good place to get gelato.
author: Linda X.

description: Amazing gelato!! I'm so glad I came to lush gelato for dessert. They open really late on the weekends which was perfect because we had a late dinner. We sampled a few flavors and ended up having the earl grey and a banana flavor that my bf loved. Their fresh mint was also really good! The gelato is creamy and smooth and you have to get it on one of their freshly made cones. The cone had a hint of cinnamon in it. Overall an amazing place for late night dessert!
author: Vy T.

description:
Tonight it's raining Maine Coon cats and Saint Bernard dogs. 
This is ice cream eating weather!
Unusual flavors here? Yes!
Organic and seasonal offerings? Yes!
Third time lucky? Yes!
Marscapone Balsamic chocolate chunk, creme fraiche black pepper chocolate chunk, fresh pear, gelato with housemade popcorn...
Definitely different, uncommon, delicate on occasions..definitely growing on me...
It's fresh, homemade gelato..nom nom nom
author: Joanna T.

description:
Found this little gem while exploring the city on foot.  Super cute, really small store front with delicious gelato.  No really ... it's DELICIOUS!  This is not your average gelato place offering standard flavor choices. Lush has unique, quirky flavor combinations that will surprise and excite your pallet. 

There was a popcorn truffle gelato and a banana with salted caramel gelato that caught my eye but I settled on the Bellwether Farms Ricotta & Lemon Zest gelato that was simply divine.  My brother got the Root Beer which was also fantastic.  There really wasn't any flavor that I wouldn't have tried and the guy behind the counter was more than happy to let us taste them all if we wanted.  

The only reason I'm not giving Lush 5 stars is the price.  It's over $3.00 for a very itty bitty scoop.  Now ... you really don't need more than one itty bitty scoop because the gelato is super duper rich.  But at $3.00 a scoop, I'm glad I don't live in this neighborhood or else I'd be broke! If I ever find myself passing Lush again, I wont hesitate to stop in and see what creative flavors are in the case and get another itty bitty scoop .... or two. YUM!
author: Christie B.

description:
My friends and I were looking for a little dessert after dinner and came across Lush. I am impressed and will be back. It is a small little shop and definitely is a grab-and-go dessert place, but what gets me is the taste. Who knew that you could combine such odd flavors and have them become delicious?! I got mascarpone balsamic & chocolate chunks and found it divine. I could have eaten six more scoops of it. The gelato was creamy and thick, just the way gelato should be. 

I love the fact that they can mix two flavors into one scoop for you (just make your two flavors mix well). It was decently priced for gelato and I had no major complaints. I did feel that service was somewhat lax. The man behind counter seemed to want us to hurry up and move on out so he could back to his computer, but it was late and we did ask him to try almost every flavor, so I could understand his appearance of annoyance, but you do work in customer service bud!
author: Tyler R.

description:
I've been to Lush Gelato other 2 locations: Berkeley Epicurious Garden & Piedmont Ave, North Oakland so was happy to try this NEW shop in SF!

He makes all the gelato in the kitchen you see through the window at this tiny shop.  There is 12 rotating flavors which you can ask for samples of.  I didn't try all of them, I think 4 and all really good.

I ended up getting: fresh mint & vanilla - small cup is $3.20.

Cone .75
1 scoop $3.20
2 scoops $4.20
3 scoops $5.20
1 pint $8.50
2 pints $16
3 pints $21
4 pints $24

There was total 2 tables & 4 chairs in the shop.  

Bus 19 stops in front.
author: Ann L.

description:
My friends and I stumbled upon this gelato place and we were so pleasantly surprised! 

The customer service was great. The man was very friendly and answered any questions we had. The price for the the two scoops I got was about 5$ so it was rather affordable. We got great portion sizes so it was well worth it. 

What I loved most about this gelato place was the flavor. Every flavor I tried tasted so good and very authentic. 

The fresh mint flavor tasted so fresh it seemed to be right off the mint plant. The 'Tahitian Vanilla' tasted just like an actual vanilla bean. The cookie dough flavor was so delicious as well. 

Great place!
author: Shotaro O.

description: The best gelato I've ever had!!! I've had my fair share of gelato and nothing touches the smoothness and flavor that this gelato has. I loved how there were so many options to choose from and some of them were uncommon which made it fun to sample. If you are in the area I highly encourage you to stop in and try it out, trust me you will not leave disappointed.
author: Victoria E.

description:
WOW!   I had the mint gelato experience and let me tell you, it's spectacular.  I've never had mint that tasted anywhere near as fresh.   Definitely get spoiled for choice at Lush - a sweet treat - and super nice stafff, too.  

You gotta love these local folks that try to make a go of the expensive rents here in San Francisco.  Support your local Gelato shop - so much better than what's in the freezer at Walgreens!
author: Kelly L.

description:
Gelato is one of my favorite things in the world - I swear I want to come by every so often to grab some. I was seeing someone in the area for a while and we would grab gelato together. 

I've tried a few different flavors so far. 
earl gray, vanilla, mascarpone balsamic, and chocolate. 

They were all pretty good - definitely love the more strange ones. The mascarpone balsamic was my favorite! 

Protip: definitely try a few flavors and then decide on your favorite!
author: Nina Y.

description: Gelato is delicious, creamy and thick! All the makings of a good gelato.  We ordered their creme brûlée gelato and it had little bits of caramelized sugar, which were to die for!  Their homemade waffle cone has a hint of cinnamon and that sugary cinnamon smell hits you in the nose as soon as you step into the ice cream parlor.  I came here with my boyfriend to satiate my sweet tooth, but I was met with the most emotionless ice cream server I've ever had the pleasure of ordering from.  The only words that were exchanged were "Hi" and "$5"? In any case, I would definitely return for their ice cream!
author: Colleen L.

description: Love the flavours at Lush Gelato. So fresh and delicious. I highly recommend the Whisky & Walnut in the waffle cone, of course!
author: Ghazal S.

description:
I'm reviewing Lush because of the fantastic Lemon gelato that was so good that I don't recall the full name of! It was light and airy, perfect for my parched self trekking through hilly SF on a hot weekend day. They also have an assortment of cheese infused gelato (marscapone, ricotta, etc). Oh wait it was LEMON RICOTTA GELATO. 

The lady is so nice to let you sample everything, so I'm sure you'll find your favorite and I'm excited for y'all!
author: Shelley C.

description:
This place ROCKS! I normally don't eat a lot of gelato either but it's hard to walk past this place without going inside!

The chef is Italian and is so passionate about the gelato he makes. He is very kind and friendly and let's you sample a few of his creations. I've never been to a gelato shop with such amazing flavors! My absolute favorite one is SMORES AND OLIVE OIL GELATO! But to be honest, all of his gelato flavors are incredible. He puts together ingredients and combinations that you would never think of, but they work! The texture is smooth and creamy and just addicting!

Their waffle cones are also made in house. I love this place. Love love love it!
author: Chisholm T.

description: I have eaten Gelato all over Italy ,over 10+ years. This establishment makes acceptable, but not great gelato. My issue is their choice  of flavors.They have only room for 10 in their refrig. display and the choices seem strange. On a Thursday night at 8, the chocoilate they offer is "Mexican Chocolate" which was sold out along with Tahitian Vanilla...maybe  2 most popular.? Theeowners obviously don't understrand making what ther customers desire, only what weird combinations  they can come up with. Thus leaving you with such delicious choices as Green Tea Gelato.  There is no Green Tea Gelato in Italy for the obvious reqason its tasts like Green tea. . What is sadly missing here are such popular flavos here as dark chcolktade, coconut, orange, tiramisou, etc. The owners IMO are trying to be too clever with their flavores and are losing business .
author: Greg B.

description:
Make some normal flavors and we'll come back... If it ain't broke, don't fix it!

Some how that old statement didn't get posted and I've since stopped by and found a very sensible chocolate and vanilla selection. I'll add a star for that and might even stop in again to see if things are looking brighter for those of us that prefer to have our vegetables with dinner, not dessert, and really well done standards.
author: D K.

description:
So fresh and delicious! Been here twice, tried 4 flavors so far - banana caramel sea salt, whiskey walnut, mint chocolate chip and vanilla with chocolate shavings, loved everyone. You can taste the true flavors of each ingredient.

Friendly staff, quick service, reasonably priced. Get the stamp card if you know you'll be back for more!
author: Angela L.

description:
Mooched off of a friend's medium mint order. Super soft, chocolate-melt-in-your-mouth, real mint but not too minty stuff. Portions are also huge; we could have shared a small. 

Overall, I'm a fan. Would definitely return to try other things!
author: Shendi X.

description: Everything about this spot is lovely. From the kind woman who served us to the incredibly delicious gelato! (I appreciate the late hours too!)
author: Katherine M.

description: I'd recommend getting an unique flavor gelato if you're going to come here. I sampled a marscapone gelato, which ended up tasting very cheesecakey (in a good way) but then played it safe and got their mint and chocolate chunk flavor. Although it was fine, it was nothing special. The people working there seemed to be a bit grumpy, but that's also understandable since it was 10:30 pm on a Friday night. Cute little place to stop by for something sweet if you're on a date and want to walk around Russian Hill.
author: Stacy K.

description:
YUMMMMMMMMM Banana salted caramel was so delicious!

Walked in this location about a 1/2 hr before it was about to close. The boyfriend and I were each planning to get a scoop. I must've tried 6 different flavors and nothing appealed to me, so the boyfriend and I just shared. The guy serving didn't seem to mind, despite having given me six different samples, which was a pleasant surprise. I truly had intentions to get my own.

Service wasn't too personable, but that's ok. 

They serve ice cold water. YAY!
They're open late. YAY! -- Perfect for date night, our dinner before lasted 3 hours.

Some funky flavors:
- Olive Oil S'mores
- Mexican Chocolate (not funky)
- Ducle de Leche (Not funky)
- Orange marmalade something something with strips of orange peels in it
- Balsalmic vinegar something something -- I put balsalmic vinegar on my ice cream at home, so was super excited to try this one, but it just didn't appeal to my taste buds for some reason. I might've just been too full, who knows. 

Scoops are pretty generous.
author: Christina L.

description:
In a city filled with delicious ice cream, I honestly think Lush may be the best. I just came back from a two week vacation in Italy and I can tell you that Lush is better than anything I had there (and we ate gelato pretty much every day during our trip, so I have plenty of points of comparison!) 

Lush has a great mix of creative favors and familiar tastes. It's a beautiful facility where you can watch the employees making the ice cream in their super clean kitchen. Other perks: low prices, and the nicest owner ever (Federico). Be careful about parking; DPT is on the watch for illegally parked cars! Go, indulge, enjoy!! Love this place so much.
author: Kerri W.

description:
Ran into this place with co-workers while we were on a "city-hike" in Russian Hill. It is a small gelato shop tucked in between different restaurants and stores on Polk. The service here is incredible! The man working there gladly allowed us to try as many flavors as we wanted and gave us suggestions. I got the Cookie Dough gelato (small is $3.50), which has a slight cheesecake flavor, which I loved! 

Get the stamp card because you will want to be coming back!
author: Katrina L.

description: Been many times! Ici and Lush are my favorite Bay Area spots for ice cream! Flavors are always interesting and so delicious, light and creamy. Always bring people from out of town here for a lovely dessert!! Well done!
author: E B.

description:
Jesus Christ I have to say this place just rose up to be my favorite gelato place in SF. Very creative flavors and insanely good texture. 

I fanatically tried 5 flavors before deciding. Not a huge fan of the donut flavor but it is quite creative. I ended up getting the pear sorbet and banana salt caramel. I have to say that I was really really impressed by the pear sorbet. I mean how often do you see pear sorbet. The sorbet even has the pear texture. Super delicious, unique and refreshing 

Banana salt caramel was quite interesting too and a very nice combination.

I would come back to get a pint of the sorbet
author: Ruxin H.

description:
I first tried Lush Gelato at Vesta in RWC and loved it. The Mint Chip is bomb!
This Lush location opened up last year and I have tasted a lot of their flavors but always end up getting their Mint Chip :P I do enjoy sampling what they have that is seasonal and the staff there is super friendly. A convenient place to grab dessert when in the area. (1760 and Amelie are across the street)
author: Angela D.

description: You can't go wrong with Lush! Best gelato out there. Their flavors keep rotating, so if there's something you don't like, sample something else, I'm sure you'll find something great. The stuff they make here is as good (and maybe better) than what I tried in Italy. Besides, they're very cool about giving samples and take great care of their regulars.
author: Patricia H.

description:
Do you like gelato? How about HAND-MADE gelato? 

Yum, Lush! Your handmade, silky, luscious gelatos are so fresh, delicious, and make me want more. As soon as I was done with two scoops and a cone, I asked bf, "Can I have another one?" I ALMOST gave in to a second round.

I digress...

Basically, I sampled everything (like no joke) and the nice guy behind the counter was really patient with my "and this one and this one and this one and this one" until I was content and made a decision.

I went with a dark orange chocolate and a lemon sorbetto. Friend got the ricotta lemon which was a close second for me but decided I wanted a contrast in texture. Bf got mint chocolate chip and chocolate espresso. The mint was SO fresh, seriously tasted like mint from the garden, none of that fake taste. 

Real-ly deal-icious!
author: Shereen A.

description: Spectacular Dulce De Leche gelato! I took it over to The Crepe House and put a couple of dollops in a hot cup of Joe (coffee)! It was perfect for me and now I am on my way happy. Thank you Lush!
author: Howard L R.

description:
I'm a sucker for dessert and gelatos are a light way to get my fix.  We were driving along Polk and saw Lush which looked new.  It was freezing outside but it sounded so good.  The person working there was super friendly and helpful.  He gave me a bunch of sample and told me about the business and how they make everything in the store.

I ended up getting an orange/lemon zest gelato and it was great.

Support local stores like you and you won't be disappointed.
author: Blake B.

description: Finally great legit small batch homemade gelato in SF. Not Italy level, but really good, great texture, yummy flavors. I'm a fan! PS: frikkin kills Naia.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Best gelato around! Homemade waffle cones!! Delicious! 

Great service. Very nice. Creme brûlée, dulce de leche and more!
author: Tara C.

description:
I randomly popped in today while walking down Polk. We hadn't noticed a gelato place on this block of Polk before.

They have really unique gelato flavors & they were patient with us when we were trying out all the flavors. 

I ultimately settled on truffle popcorn. And I definitely did not have any regrets.
author: Grace C.

description:
Lush Gelato
8/30/15, 9:07 am
 Customer Service
Not the friendliest guy at counter, he was not too jazzed to have to deal with two kids under ten. I smiled at him bunch of time, he just stared till finally he was able to half smile. Why work in an ice cream shop if you cant handle kids? One tried 2 flavors, wasn't for him. The older one didnt even taste any at all, just got a scoop. It's not like they were tasting all day. There were no other customers. Wont be back!

Reply: 
Today, 10:38 pm
Hi, sorry if I didn't look very friendly, I was doing too many things at the same time (I also manage our production that's in the back of the store). As for the flavors, our place is not really for kids, I always assume it's obvious but I should have warned you when you came in.

Today, 10:57 pm
The 9 yr old was happy with what he ordered. Why would an ice cream store be obviously not for kids?! And it was not that lack of kid friendly flavors that made it unpleasant, it was yer demeanor of being put upon. If U dont want kids there U should post a sign. But I dont think it was the kids, I think you are just perhaps not a people person- fair enough. So stay in the back and work the magic and get someone else who has no problem making EVERYONE - all ages - feel welcome! It's ice cream- not wine! C'mon dude!
author: Laur A.

description: Can I give this 6 stars? Don't ever skip out on Lush Gelato if you're visiting Polk Street. Their flavors change daily and will leave you wanting more every time. I love it here!
author: Kerry G.

description:
This guys make the ice-cream from scratch! It's sooo creamy! 
Loved the mexican chocolate.
The owner, Federico is great. Really friendly. Ask him about the whole process, and he'll be happy to talk you through it.
author: Maggie J.

description:
Excellent completely handmade gelato! 

Unlike BiRite and Humphrey Slocombe, they make their base of eggs, Strauss cream and sugar from scratch. 

I tried the green tea, earl grey and truffle popcorn with the earl grey being my favorite!

I also tried the raspberry, which is also amazing!
author: Anthony K.

description: I've been to this place a few times and I do that when I need to convince myself that it can be better. A solid 3 star for a gelato joint. Too sweet for my taste. I love the idea of freshly made ice cream in house and all that good stuff and maybe other prefer it that way but it's just to sweet. That could be a good thing.
author: Miguel Y.

description:
Lush Gelato is chill :) 
I love this place, the scoops are plentiful and the flavors are delicious. I have so many favorites but the current ones on the top of my list are Orange Cardamom and dark Chocolate
author: Marissa C.

description: Favorite dessert spot on Polk st. All the ice cream flavors are delicious and made on site. Takes me back to Italy every time
author: Saurabh B.

description:
Really? Five stars from that many people? I'm skeptical. I brought my two kids here so we shared our samples as well as our purchased scoops and I have to say I wasn't wowed by any of the 6 flavors we tried. Nor was I wowed by the service. 

A couple flavors were decent, but overall it was pretty blah for me and I found the popcorn flavor to be just weird. It's fabulous to have a gelato place in that 'hood but I probably wouldn't return.
author: Jen K.

description: SO DELICIOUS! Flavors change daily & there are some really unique/ interesting combos offered. I'm a little worried about living so close to here - it's hard to resist going in once you get a glimpse of the daily menu!
author: Catherine S.

description:
Holy cow the gelato here is so delicious !

Tried the raspberry sorbetto, the  popcorn truffle, some strawberry and vinaigrette one (this one was my favorite) and earl grey. They make all their gelato in house. Definitely one of the best icecream / gelato places I have ever had. Looks like they have different rotating flavors. 3.50 for a scoop (they let me do half and half of two flavors for 3.50). 4.50 for two scoops, 5.50 for three scoops. I recommend that you try more than one flavor!

Lots of street parking and perfect for a dessert spot after dinner in the many places near by.
author: Hiroshi K.

description:
damn, i wish i tried more flavors but i got bashful. i tried some marscapone flavor or maybe it was ricotta, either way, it was too cheesy. i ended up getting the espresso with chocolate chunks on a waffle cone.
their waffle cone alone is worth the trip.  
they sell chocolate covered alfajoles which is like a...dulce de leche cookie..? almost.
it's worth a taste, i liked it :)
the lady behind the counter said it was Argentinian gelato bc the owners are Argentinian. I couldn't tell if she was making a joke.. Either way it was good gelato :)
author: Jess K.

description:
Haven't had gelato this good since Florence.

It's definitely worth a visit even if it's out of your way.
author: Whitne Y.

description:
LOVE. 

The peaches and ricotta ( I think it was) cheese gelato sounds horrible but it was delicious.  Super fresh peaches and just enough sweet and savory tasting to be amazing. LOVE IT but it's not always there! Popcorn Truffle is great but a bit more like a strong chocolate. Mexican chocolate was great and a bit spicy. Strawberry vinaigrette was yummy without being too odd as well. Plus you can try flavors out first which I highly recommend!  I also like that it's open pretty later in the day so you can get a bite before getting a few drinks nearby. :)
author: Diana R.

description: This place is super cute and tucked here. I come here every now and then for gelato as I walk over to my friend's place. My favorite flavor is cardamon and orange.
author: Joanne W.

description: Delicious, inventive, and creative gelato.  This is the best gelato I've had in SF hands down. They rotate flavors so you can always try something new.  My favorites have been the mexican chocolate and cow girl creamery (with giant cookie dough chunks!).  The guy who runs the place, Frederico, is knowledgeable, friendly, and will give you as many samples as you want.  Scoops are also generously served in decomposable (yay!) cups.   Do your tastebuds a favor and stop by Lush :)!
author: Corrina S.

description: totally a fan of this place! everything is made in house in the kitchen right in the storefront, and the owner is amazingly sweet! i first had a sample of lush while walking by to nick's but didnt have a chance to stop by, but today i didnt pass it up! i tried - espresso, dulce de leche, fresh mint and stout beer and waffle cone! honestly the flavors were all so unique~! would totally be back for this on a hot day!
author: Christina L.

description: This is my go-to spot for gelato. It's down the street from me so I stop by once a week. All their flavors are good and you can tell they spent a lot of time perfecting it. Out of all their flavors I have to say the one that has blown me away is their Tahitian Vanilla! Wtf, most basic flavor is now not so basic. I've literally told all my friends and their moms and extended families to try it. Also if you post a pic on Instagram and tag them, you get a chance to win a free pint if they select your picture!
author: Robyn K.

description:
This place opened up semi-recently across the street where my gf and I live and we've been several times. Each time we go, the service is friendly and they have brand new concoctions for us to try. They encourage tasting before buying and so do I. You're not going to be exposed to simple flavors like strawberry or mint chocolate chip. It will be things like "balsamic mascarpone." You might not like all the flavors, but I guarantee there is something delicious for everyone. The price is also extremely fair. 

Every time I've been I've enjoyed this place. The people who work there are visibly enthused when you like something, it's a cool atmosphere. It's new, but it feels like it fits perfectly into the neighborhood, and we're lucky to have it nearby. Whether you're in the neighborhood or just visiting, this is a place you have to visit.
author: Sean D.

description: I came here yesterday before work because it was one of those rare hot, humid San Francisco days. I work 2 blocks away, and always hear people rave about the gelato. I thought, it's hot, I'm early to work, and I love gelato. So I went there and it's a lot smaller than I thought, and they only carry 6 flavors at a time - I ended up with the dairy free nectarine, but next time the dulce de leche sounded will be my go to. The nectarine was really refreshing and delicious, so I was happy. It was $3.50 for a single scoop, which would normally be a little pricey in my opinion but it was so good that I would say it's well worth it. In terms of customer service, I can't say, I kind of rushed in and out so I could get to work, but the guy behind the counter seemed nice!
author: Shira S.

description: I went 2 times to buy gelato at this place, each time I go I feel so frustrated, all I see is a line of people in front of me trying to taste and test every free sample of gelato, and I wait and I wait and I wait and all I see is the cashier is giving free samples to those customers while they are talking and discussing the taste of each sample, this bullshit happens only in America, this store should focus only on real customers who wants to buy not on phony customers who want to get  free gelato samples, what a cheap customers
author: imad k.

description: This is a small place with delicious gelato!! Super nice employee, yummy stuff. I had CowgirlCreamery fromage blanc /cookie dough, and it was fabulous. My husband loved his mint chocolate chip!
author: Margaret O.

description: This is my favorite ice cream in the city. Even though I'm much closer to bi-rite, Humphrey slocombe, and Mitchells, I will trek across town to Lush. Their fresh mint chocolate chip is unparalleled and their earl grey has great flavor. The dulce de Leche is rich and deep without being cloying or sweet. They're constantly rotating the flavors, so you'll have to come a few times to taste them all (but it will be worth it)
author: Ty Y.

description: This stuff is legit. The owner makes everything from scratch with the best ingredients. I seriously love the coffee flavored with chocolate pieces.
author: Grace E.

description: Some of the best ice cream I have ever had!  This small store front packs in great service and flavorful delights.  I had the creme fraiche & strawberry balsamic gelato.  I asked for a sample to try since it sounded different and I loved it.  It tasted like cheesecake!  My kids had the dark chocolate gelato and fresh mint and chocolate chunks gelato.  All of us had our gelato on a waffle cone. So glad we did.  Enjoy!
author: Jessica W.

description:
The gelato here is different, but it is still really good gelato. It's not as creamy as your typical gelato but Lush makes up for that with the crazy flavors they come up with on a regular basis. 

Espresso with Chocolate Chunk - 2/5 - Meh...flavor was incosistent, and not very espresso tasting. The chocolate chunks were good, but overall bland.

Brown sugar spice rum - 4/5 - The flavor is pretty damn awesome. You can definitely taste the different notes of rum, sugar, and spices. If only it had some alcohol content.

Mexican Chocolate with Cinnamon - 4/5 - The chocolate is super rich, and then you ge t the afterkick of the cinnamon. It's not sweet cinnamon flavor like a cinnamon roll, but a spicy cinnamon like Big Red. It goes surprisingly well with the chocolate, and its good with a scoop of the Brown Sugar Spice Rum too.
author: Mike L.

description:
really refreshing yummy goodness.... i tried the olive oil and smores.. not bad... i should've gotten the strawberry one instead since the smores made me feel fat afterwards.

really satisfying! it was literally 80-90 degrees in the city today! this place is a must for a cool down.

side note: they ran out of ice cream cones today... :( bummer...
author: ABC Z.

description:
Cold spell.

"It's like selling to eskimos" is what the extremely friendly and engaging owner Federico told me when asked about business during our recent below normal temperatures.

Don't worry my friend.

With a great story (http://www.zagat.com/b/san-francisco/sweet-tooth-lush-gelato-opens-on-polk-street) and even better homemade gelato (Fresh Mint & Chocolate Chip was incredible) sales will be good in any weather.

If there is anything to complain about it's the overwhelming selection which includes a few healthier sorbets. Federico is generous with samples and everything tastes so good.

Single scoop for $3.20 was reasonable and portion plenty. Do save budget and room for a homemade waffle cone for an extra $0.75. Hints of cinnamon made it extra awesome.

Simply spellbound.
author: Jason B.

description: Probably one of the best ice cream places in town with homemade ice cream and authentic flavors. I tried the line graham cracker ice cream and it was absolutely delicious! It included soft chunks of graham cracker and traces of lime peel. Also, they're Belgian waffle cones crisp and fresh!
author: Mary ..

description: Got the mint chocolate ice cream, the mint flavor was so natural and made me wonder what was in those mint flavored ice cream I had elsewhere. Would love to be back for the mint, or other flavors that I test tasted and was so tempted (like malt milk). Also if going with someone, getting 2 scoops in one cup/cone was about half cheaper than two separately.
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
Was walking around the city with my sister and randomly stumbled upon this place... despite my negative expierence at their north berkeley location I decided to give them another shot.

Sooooo glad that I did!!! Somehow the texture here was so much better than that at the berkeley location. Maybe it was an off day there or maybe since they make it fresh at this location it actually is better...? Anywhoo, it was actual gelato and not just creamy semi elastic texture either. Was super happy with that.

Got the Bob's glazed donut and Crème Fraîche w/ chocolate chunks and pepper. Highly recommended this combo!

The donut flavor literally tasted like a glazed donut but gelato texture (no chunks). 

I normally don't like spicy with my sweet but you couldn't tell there was pepper in the gelato at all... just a strong pepper after taste! The pepper was perfectly complimented with the sourness from the crème fraîche and the slight sweetness and bitterness from the dark chocolate. This went extremely well with the sweet and rich donut flavored gelato! 

Their Cowgirl Creamery Fromage Blanc Cookie Dough flavor is really good as well! A bit of a sourness/sharpness to it with generous chunks of cookie dough!

The guy here was a lot nicer and more helpful than the girl at the berkeley store... thank you for giving me an adequate sample so I could make an actual judgment based off if it!  

Would give this 5 stars if it had a MORE "taffy" like texture that I love about gelato. At least it's there, would just personally prefer more. Still great and highly recommended for frozen treat connoisseurs!!
author: Melissa C.

description: This is the best gelato place in town.  Not only is the gelato high quality, there is a nice assortment of flavors--including a Bob's Donuts flavor. Make sure to also get a cone. They are freshly baked and have a hint of cinnamon.
author: Sam S.

description: I am so exasperated about my inability to find good gelato in this city. Once again, gross flavors taste artificial and too sweet.
author: Jessica P.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for months, but because I don't walk along Polk often I never got to, until today! I didn't really get a greeting when I came in, but I was focused on all the interesting flavors anyway.  They're all very unique and original. When the woman came to take my order she was very kind. I went for the 2 scoop of Popcorn Truffle and Beer stout and chocolate waffle (something like that). When she scooped 2 of the Popcorn, I thought she made a mistake, but then she went for the beer and as a result, i got 2 scoops per flavor. For $4.50. Unbelievable. When I gave it a try, the popcorn truffle shocked me at first, but it turned out better and better each bite. I fell in love with this one immediately. I would definitely come back for more.
author: Yvonne N.

description: The scoop of expresso gelato was divine. The Tahitian vanilla was delicious. My daughter had the brownie sandwich and totally loved it.
author: Sergio T.

description:
It was the right thing to do....88 degrees outside and a perfect SF weekend spent in the sun could only be capped off with a stop at this new gem. 

You can tell they are still filling out the space, i hope to see more flavor choices in the near future! But, they do have some unique flavor options - think popcorn truffle, bourbon butterfinger...I opted for the malted milk and enjoyed it.  I may have sampled 4 other flavors, but who's counting?

Happy to welcome this place to the 'hood :)
author: Brianna M.

description:
Tried quite a few flavors and you can tell that they are made with fresh and top quality ingredients. 

You can see them making the gelato from the window.

Some that I tried and are great are the popcorn, fresh mint with choc chip, the Mexican, plus the Peruvian chocolate, banana salted caramel and one with cheese that I don't recall the name, it had cookie dough as well. Once you try their gelato, you won't need to go anywhere else for it.
author: Gaston B.

description: They had excellent flavors! True Italian! Good Area! Bets Mint Gelato I've ever had!!!!
author: Bryson H.

description:
I love everything about this place: the friendly owner, the inventive flavors, the rotation of twelve gelatos available every time. I also think it's a nice touch that the tasting spoons are metal and not plastic/throwaway. I believe it says a lot about how the guy runs his business.

Now, on to the gelato: first visit, a few weeks ago, I tried a few: lemon ricotta, cowgirl creamery cream cheese and a caramel one (I believe). Went with lemon ricotta and loved it. Last Sunday night, I returned and went with Vietnamese Cinnamon, which was delicious. I also sampled the Bob's Donut flavor which was awesome, as was the brown sugar rum one.

I can't wait for my next visit! (Oh, and I forgot to pick up a loyalty card on my first trip, and he gave me the makeup stamp - and one more! - when I got it on the second visit. Very nice.)
author: David B.

description: The best mint gelato I've ever had! I feel I can say this with confidence as I'm from north east Italy, land of gelato. Really fantastic gelato made from scratch here. Check them out!
author: Martina Z.

description:
Great gelato.  They make everything fresh from scratch and have really unique flavors.  I had the Stout Beer with Chocolate Waffle Bits and we also tried a bit of the Mint Chocolate Chip.  Both were amazing. 

Quick service too!
author: Farid V.

description: OH MY GOODNESS!!! Incredible gelato!!! And for such a great price! I was so pleasantly surprised by the vastly different selection of flavored and the uniqueness of each!! I WILL be back and I WILL be expecting great things :):)
author: Shep G.

description:
I love ice cream in general, and since I moved to the USA I've been looking for a good ice cream place... until I FOUND IT!! They made ice cream from scratch and even the sweet cone they make it right there. 

I've tried dulce de leche flavor!! That is an authentic Argentinian flavor and it tastes just like back home. It was AWESOME!! 

I recommend this place for ice cream fans like me!!
author: Agustina R.

description: Really delicious!! For $3.50 for a giant scoop, I think it is a pretty good deal since the flavors are always so unique and fresh. Make sure to get a stamp card because you can gather enough to get some free scoops.
author: Jenny M.

description:
On a sunday afternoon, my friend and I decided to sample gelato ice cream. 
It is close to a lot of businesses, which has bike racks and car parking nearby. 
The space is small and cute. I wish I could have a tour of the gelato making.  The sliver spoons for sampling are cute. Sampling the olive oil and smores was nice.It had a hit of olive oil and s'mores as a surprise. I got the strawberry sorbetto with a waffle cone. It was delicious. 
The flavors change on a daily to weekly basis. I am happy that I have gelato once in a while.
author: Kristal C.

description: The first thing I noticed upon entering this parlor is the welcoming smell of cinnamon. This was my first visit. I ordered the lemon and ricotta gelato. The flavor was rich with fresh lemon zest. The flavor could have used a little more acidity.
author: Pamela D.

description: I've never had such a fresh-tasting mint gelato/ice cream/frozen yogurt, and mint is my favorite flavor.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Legit dulce de leche gelato! Quite similar to what you can get back at home (Argentina)
Did I mention you can get high quality ice cream in the city without waiting in line?
author: Ignacio B.

description: Came here for dessert last night and was as happy as I was at the Piedmont location! The flavors are so pow in your face and I'm not usually an ice cream person so it tells you smthg when I suggested coming here. Creme Fraiche with Spiced Apples, Dulce de leche and Chocolate with Orange sorbet were our winning flavors of the night. Here's a tip: you can do two flavors with each scoop. Best way to try more!
author: Nicole G.

description: Delicious gelato!  I had the espresso one and it was very nice and creamy.  Next time I'm in the area I'll make sure to stop by.
author: a f.

description: It was very subpar, nothing great. The woman at the register spoke Spanish and we would ask her questions but she didn't understand us because of the language barrier which was a little frustrating. We made a trip specifically to this place because of its ratings and there was nothing very special about its flavors. The best was mango because it was so strong in flavor but everything else was just ok.
author: Melissa P.

description:
I come here all the time me and Angelica. The owner is so humble despite having the best ice cream in San Francisco. Love the strong, creative flavors and texture. The ever changing tastes makes it a wonder every time you enter. Make sure you ask for samples before you buy!
