Tip: Order a one-scoop half-and-half to save money and still get two flavors. 

- Chris and Angelica
author: Chris K.

description: I've driven by a few times, but had never walked in so decided to finally walk in, one day after work, and try since the weather was nice and clear.  Had the popcorn truffle; initially, I was expecting the flavor to the likes of a Jelly Belly popcorn jellybean--strong but not too strong.  However, this popcorn truffle is quite nice--not overly sweet, yet had that light buttery flavor.  I'd recommend getting this on a waffle cone. When I'm in the area, I'll return to try their more adventurous flavors.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I've traveled the globe trying gelato from Italy, France, Argentina but it seems the best is in my backyard! I'm quickly filling up my punch card at Lush Gelato. I discovered Lush from a friend's party where they catered gelato.

Love their unique and rich flavors - Dulce de Leche, Malted Milk, Mascarpone with Dark Choco, Earl Grey Tea, Butterfinger, Strawberry Basil...

The gelato has a really creamy texture; the flavors taste fresh and authentic- Mint tastes like fresh mint, the Mascarpone is smooth and tangy. They also have Alfajores cookies and homemade waffle cones.

I've always had great service when I've gone in... the owner is friendly and offers samples and keeps the line moving when it's busy.

Glad to have a local small business join the Polk neighborhood! I'm looking forward to trying their delivery service!
author: Kensie E.

description: Came all the way over here for the Donut Ice cream sandwich they show all over their instagram- not only did they not have the donut ice cream sandwich, they were pretty much out of most flavors & the lady helping us (or lack thereof) didnt seem to care that we were a bit disappointed with what they had to offer. Headed to Bob's donuts after. Definitely Won't be back here.
author: Ashley B.

description:
Love love love this place! I typically get a pint and they are patient enough with me to make recommendations as well as let me try many things. 

Their flavors are unique and they also have the classics. I think the mint chip is my favorite, but they had a great pumpkin spice around Halloween and a really interesting cheese flavored one recently. Love it! Gonna go grab some more now!

Very good neighborhood addition. Glad they are here!
author: jenica b.

description: Lush is the perfect name for this gelato shop.  The gelato is luscious, the use of flavor is lush, engaging all my senses.  My favorite flavor, a combination of Malbac, black coarsely ground pepper, and fresh fig frozen into gelato.  Oh yum!!  And, I'm not forgetting the other delicious flavors!  Incidentally, my favorite flavor turned out to be a true aphrodisiac!  I'm walking down Polk St. when I realized certain delightful feelings were occurring with no stimulus except the gelato.  Therefore, I highly recommend the Fig, Malbac, and Black Pepper or something like that as I can't remember the flavor's exact name.  This may be a tragedy in the making because I definitely want more and the owners of Lush have a very special flavor here.  I giggle every time I think of it.  Good job, gelato maker!
author: Julia C.

description: IPA beer Gelato. Such yum. They let you try as many flavors as you want a the counter. Definitely tempted to get everything, even though I don't have much of a sweet tooth. The mint flavor actually tastes like fresh mint. The espresso has that kick of flavor. But the IPA was the star for me. You can taste the slight bitter flavor that is enhanced and rolls with the chocolate chunks. Love it.
author: Ani Y.

description: Phenomenal in the innovative category and phenomenal in the creaminess category. I love this place! Complete hidden gem, worth checking out!
author: Casie M.

description: Not very enthusiastic- the dude who was serving us. The flavors were very hipster but not the most delicious.
author: Wildeflower M.

description: Talk about interesting flavors! I never could have even imagined putting some of the flavor combinations together but they were great. The woman behind the counter was very friendly and let us try as many flavors as we wanted before ordering. Although less interesting, I opted for the dulce de luche and Madagascar vanilla - which were both extremely delicious. Not much room to sit down inside and talk with people but nonetheless a great stop for a quick treat.
author: Kelly J.

description: Awesome, awesome gelato. This is my favorite ice cream or gelato spot in the city. The flavors are amazingly fresh and the regularly rotate in unique new creations.
author: Beth W.

description: Love that they are open late. I tried and LOVED their Stout Beer and dulce leche! I wanted to come back the next day to try more flavors but unfortunately we had no time. :(
author: Tiffany T.

description:
what i ordered... dulce de leche

i tasted a couple of them weird name flavors and they were as bad as their names so i settled with the tried and true name and to my astonishment i hit the jackpot of regret..... it was the saltiest and sweetest ice cream i've ever eaten and to top it off the SMALLEST SCOOP serving i've ever seen in an ice cream shop.


ambiance... ok (tiny but clean)
service... bad (dude at the counter don't wanna be bothered at all, he just want you to point on an item and get lost)
cost... $- (expensive)
author: Gors P.

description: Outstanding gelato! The dulce de leche one is as if you were having it in Argentina. Don't miss it.
author: H M.

description: I don't really eat ice cream or gelato, but I have to say this shop sells some amazing gelato! I love their Irish Cream Gelato. Smooth, deliciously flavored, and creamy. I normally do not even eat gelato, and now I am a fan of this place!
author: Lisa X.

description: Disappointing experience. Firstly, the surliest server I've ever encountered in an ice cream shop.  He never cracked a smile.  Acted like I was a disturbance. Also, have never been to a gelato store anywhere that wouldn't allow at least 2 flavors  - so I just got one scoop of mint chocolate chunk which was sorely lacking in chocolate chunks. In Italy I've been told it's a law that you get at least 2 flavors! (Ok -maybe not a law but certainly standard practice).  While eating, I read a Yelp tip about the scoop card so I asked a new different server if we could have one. She looked around & said they were out. "Sorry. No offer to even write on a business card that we had had 2 scoops.  Eating gelato should just be more fun than this. I won't be back.
author: Judy M.

description: Rum and eggnog was delicious, and even the cone was good. They give you a loyalty card for buy 10, get 1 free.
author: Kira G.

description: Best gelato place in SF.  Wonderfully inventive flavors.  I just had Olive Oil and Smores ... flavors I never thought would go together, and never dreamed would be in gelato.   Yet, it was outstanding.   I have several others: Mexican Chocolate, Cowgirl Creamery Fromage Blanc w/ Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, Tahitian Vanilla.   Every one has been outstanding, as was the Chocolate-Orange Sorbetto.   It's also interesting to watch them actually make their original creations right on the premises.  I'll admit, I'm  a big fan.
author: Chris A.

description: It's cool how they're open till midnight on weekends-- definitely good for my late night sweet tooth cravings! I got to sample a bunch of their flavors, and most of them were really pleasant. They have good mint gelato; my experience with fresh mint flavors in gelato and ice cream from other is that they taste strongly like toothpaste- Thank you Lush for not making toothpaste flavored gelato :). I settled with their banana-caramel-salt, which was amazing at first but in the end turned out to be a bit too rich for me. You can really taste the high quality in their ingredients, and their gelato is indeed quite luscious. I wish they had more fruity flavors/sorbets because those are what I often seek out in gelato places!
author: Hannah P.

description: No doubt the best gelato in town. The dark chocolate is outstanding so are their seasonal fruit sorbets. Why did it take me so long to walk into the store ? Pistachio, hazelnut so Italian flavors ! I am waiting for a giandura ( chocolate+ hazelnut) to surface soon....or a limoncello.....or a very dark expresso....or a spumoni with chunks of cherries,  and candied fruits and nuts....Que sera sera ! Fabricio, do you hear us ?
author: Liliane B.

description: Delicious gelato... Seriously. This is a hidden gem. We had mint w chocolate chunks and lemon basil sorbetto. Handmade but without the hefty price tag. Become a regular!
author: Anne E.

description: Best gelato i've ever had. i like gelato / ice cream / froyo and i used to get it sometimes when i was in the mood. Now i get it all the time and only from this place. It's freaking delicious. The mascarpone with cookie dough is ridiculous, though they don't have it every week.
author: Calvin L.

description: First time I've been here. Product was great!  Great taste.  But the guy behind the counter (curly hair) had such a bad attitude. Never smiled. The only words he spoke were the total for our purchase. Made me feel as if I was intruding. Never going back. It's a shame. Great product. I know my $3.50 won't break them, but that's $3.50 they won't be getting. Oh, he spoke to the people that came in after us. And he smiled.  I would give just one star because of his poor customer service skills but the product was good.
author: Paul H.

description: I'm a gelato connoisseur, lived in Florence, and have tried every gelato place under the sun. And for some reason, this place trumps even the most famous gelato stores in Italy. The texture is always on point and the flavors unique and refined. Federico, the owner and maker has a true talent and a passion for his craft. Not to mention, he's friendly and attentive. Hands down, pure excellent gelato.
author: Gina S.

description: Best gelato in SFO! You should go and try all the innovative flavors they have. Dulce de leche is my favorite!
author: Maria O.

description: This place is so legit. No joke. They do gelato RIGHT. everything is so refined and they have these amazing cones that are of course house made with I want to say Vietnamese cinnamon if I'm not mistaken. Like whoa. So good. The flavors are inventive and delicious! Not to mention every time I go in there the service is awesome. Do your self a favor and support this place. Hope it stays in this spot forever!
author: Raquel F.

description: Terrific gelato, excellent service and great atmosphere. You know it's fresh because it's made right there and you can see it! The owner is a great dude and has an eye for great flavor. Highly re comes coming here.
author: A. D.

description: I want to like this place a lot more than I do right now, it's super convenient, reasonably priced and staffed by very nice friendly helpful people. I just didn't like the flavors I had. Bourbon butterfingers and Malted Milk with salted chocolate chunks sounded good but the flavors just didn't mesh together in the gelato. I ended up with a cup of Mexican chocolate which was good but I'm in no hurry to retry.
author: Poppy C.

description: Yum!!!!! Great gelato find on Polk street! We ordered the mint and chocolate strawberry and they were delicious! The young man behind the counter was so patient with us while we made our pick
author: Lara S.

description: I'm not one to write many reviews, but I had to for this place. Hands down best ice cream ever! The pear sorbet is like eating a fresh pear... Amazing. And the mint ice cream is to DIE for. All the ice cream is made fresh at the location and you can taste it. I will be coming back here to try all the other flavors!!!
author: Sonia P.

description: You aren't going to find the everyday go to's like  pistachio or stracciatella. The offerings here are more of a craft variety. You can actually see the popcorn that is used for one of their flavors. I sampled about six flavors and not one of them disappointed. Decided to go with the Vietnamese Cinnamon. Wow! Perfect amount of cinnamon without the gritty, sandpaper feeling. So happy this spot popped up in the hood. Grazie mille!!
author: Robert B.

description: This is some of the best gelato I have ever had.  It is creamy, not icy and made with natural ingredients.  I love that they have unique flavors and change them up.  Recently I had the creme brulee and the vanilla, both of which were great. Their waffle cones are also delicious.
author: Alissa D.

description: One of the best gelatos around, and they have very delicious dulce de leche, which in the US tends to be bland and without enough flavor, but Lush does it how it should be done! The Mexican chocolate was also quite amazing.
author: Greg D.

description: Was never a big fan of gelato UNTIL a guest brought some over, fantastic. Small shop where the owner makes everything in house from quality ingredients with originality and pride, fantastic.
author: Paul W.

description: Its tempting to give this new outlet a 1 star review, just to keep away the hourdes of marina-ites that have suddenly invaded the very neighborhood where this true gem of a gelato store is now centered. However that would be unfair to the authentic, Argentine owner of Lush Gelato. He seems like such a nice guy and boy does he make a great, craft Gelato! It reminded me of those I consumed in Buenos Aires or Florence in days gone by. But this is maybe even better. There probably no stopping the tide of 20 somethings anyway. Seeing how Bob's Donuts just down the street from Lush now has LINES out the front with Hipsters trying to get a damm fried donut that they read about on line or in some guide book saying how great it was.
author: Mark B.

description: Great place! Really awesome gelato with truly creative flavors. The prices are also great. Way better than bi-rite!!
author: Artur O.

description: I chose Earl Grey and dark chocolate gelato.  Both were delicious however, I couldn't really tell the Earl Grey after the first couple of licks.  But the dark chocolate was delicious.  I wasn't interested in the other "unique" flavors.
author: J W.

description: I love the gelato here!  Very creative and absolutely delicious.  The man serving the scoops was as cute as could be and was genuinely attentive and friendly.  This is a true sweet spot on Polk.
author: Christina C.

description: This place is insane. By far the best ice cream/gelato in the city! Can't choose a favorite flavor, they are all amazing
author: Rachel L.

description: Love love love love Lush! Quite impressed with what I have tried so far. Great flavors, not overwhelmingly sweet, amazing texture. So far, I've tried the Popcorn Truffle gelato, Bourbon Butterfinger, Rum, and Ricotta Meyer lemon. Yum! I now have Lush and Ici (in Berkeley's Elmwood neighborhood) as my two favorite ice cream places. Both make their ice creams fresh on the premises. Lush, however, is steps away from my home. I hope they will offer homemade toppings and waffle cones like Ici does in the future. Welcome to the neighborhood, Lush!! Pleeeease staaaay!
author: Rindah L.

description: Fantastic gelato with a classy atmosphere. I had the strawberry sorbet and it was phenomenal - balanced sweetness with tiny grains from the strawberry itself. We'll be back.
author: Z K.

description: Fabulous gelato -- and one of the few places to get it near Nob Hill.  Absolutely love it!  Great flavors, helpfully served.  Do patronize!  We need to keep this in the neighborhood because it's a rare treat!
author: Judith K.

description: This place has some of the best frozen treats I've had.  Lots of creative, rich, and creamy gelato.  The flavors vary which is good and bad: you get to try new stuff but if you are craving a particular flavor, it may or may not be there.  Everything we've tried had been delicious but the strawberry cheesecake is one of our absolute favorites.
author: A. B.

description: I am so glad that one, cute and fun shops are moving south down Polk st and that two, they are as good as Lush. I have been there too many times than is probably healthy for me. I have also introduced the place to several friends who are now regulars. The owner is frequently there and loves to share his creative process and inspiration for the ice cream. I try to have a new flavor every time and I have never been disappointed!
author: Eleni J.
